meanings.definition: To assemble or put together in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will preassemble the furniture before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The workers preassemble the parts to save time during construction.
meanings.sent3: He decided to preassemble the puzzle pieces to prank his friend.
meanings.sent4: She likes to preassemble her outfit in her mind before getting dressed.
meanings.sent5: The chef will preassemble the ingredients for the cake to ensure a smooth baking process.

meanings.definition: To prepare or arrange for assembly beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The team will preassemble the presentation slides for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preassemble all the tools before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to preassemble their study notes for the exam.
meanings.sent4: She likes to preassemble her thoughts before speaking in public.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic will preassemble the engine parts to streamline the repair process.
